data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Warehousing and Logistics Policy 2022 - Logistics Park - Front end subsidies - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides Front-end subsidies of 100% stamp duty exemption, 75% waiver on land use conversion and development charges for logistics park project.
data.eligibility: All existing units who wants to setup Logistics Park project (Logistics facilities, Infrastructure facilities, Business & Commercial facilities) are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions: Eligible Logistics Park project means those projects developed on atleast 25 acres of land in the State.EIP (Eligibility Investment Period) starts from the first investment date within the effective period and lasts up to 5 years or until commercial operations begin, whichever is earlier.Eligible Capital Investment refers to capital investment made during the eligible investment period. If investment starts before the effective date, at least 80% must be made after the effective date for it to be considered eligible for incentives.Reimbursements are provided after commercial operations begin, subject to verification.Applicant must submit a Bank Guarantee, released after commercial operations begin.Exemptions and concessions will be provided only after verifying the unique ID issued by the Nodal Agency.
data.beneficiaries: All existing units who wants to setup Logistics Park project (Logistics facilities, Infrastructure facilities, Business & Commercial facilities) are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites: Eligible Logistics Park project means those projects developed on atleast 25 acres of land in the State.EIP (Eligibility Investment Period) starts from the first investment date within the effective period and lasts up to 5 years or until commercial operations begin, whichever is earlier.Eligible Capital Investment refers to capital investment made during the eligible investment period. If investment starts before the effective date, at least 80% must be made after the effective date for it to be considered eligible for incentives.Reimbursements are provided after commercial operations begin, subject to verification.Applicant must submit a Bank Guarantee, released after commercial operations begin.Exemptions and concessions will be provided only after verifying the unique ID issued by the Nodal Agency.
data.nodal_agency: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority (UPSIDA)
data.context: Logistics is crucial in the global economy as it facilitates the exchange of goods and services for money through trade. This industry not only fosters economic growth but also addresses environmental and social concerns.
data.objective: The UP Government aims to enhance warehousing and logistics infrastructure, encourage private investment, create jobs, and adopt smart logistics methods through a new policy.
data.description: Scheme provides Front-end subsidies for logistics park project:Stamp Duty Exemption: 100% exemption on land purchased or leased for at least 10 years.Land Use Conversion Charge Concession: 75% waiver.Development Charge Exemption: 75% exemption.Ground Coverage: Up to 60% allowed, subject to safety regulations.Other Facilities: 30% of the land can be used for non-logistics services (commercial and common facilities).FSI of 1 for logistics facilities and up to 1.5 for non-logistics facilities.Floating FSI allowed within the same category (logistics or non-logistics) but not between them.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can register themselves to the given following link: https://niveshmitra.up.nic.in/Default.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority (UPSIDA)
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the incentives after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.checklist_info_a:
Project Proposal/Business Plan
Proof of Land Ownership or Lease Agreement
Company Registration Documents
PAN Card and GST Registration
Bank Guarantee (if required for exemptions)
Environmental Clearance (if applicable)
Affidavit or Undertaking for Project Commitment
Financial Statements (Balance Sheets, Profit & Loss)
Proof of Eligibility for Incentives (e.g., investment details)
Proof of Compliance with Local Authority Regulations
Approvals from Industrial/Development Authorities (if applicable)
